==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|く|げ}}
Probably originally from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=くげ}} {{m|ltc|公家}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|公家|tr=gōngjiā||the [[state]], the [[public]]}}. The meaning in {{etyl|ja|-}} developed from “great [[house]], great [[family]]” to then signify “the imperial [[family]]”, then by extension the [[courtier]]s, and again the [[nobility]].<ref>{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

The reading is an alteration from the expected [[呉音#Japanese|go'on]] reading of ''kuke''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|くげ|acc=0|acc_ref=NHK,DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|公卿}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|くげ}}

# the [[imperial]] [[court]]
# the [[emperor]] and [[courtier]]s
# the [[nobility]] in general

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|こう|か}}
The [[漢音#Japanese|''kan'on'']] reading, suggesting a later borrowing. Rarely used.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|こうか}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|こうか}}

# {{lb|ja|rare|sort=こうか}} the [[imperial]] [[court]]
# {{lb|ja|rare|sort=こうか}} the [[emperor]] and [[courtier]]s

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|こう|け}}
Mixed reading, using the [[漢音#Japanese|''kan'on'']] for {{ja-l|公}} and the [[呉音#Japanese|''go'on'']] for {{ja-l|家}}. Rarely used.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|こうけ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|こうけ}}

# {{lb|ja|rare|sort=こうけ}} the [[imperial]] [[court]]
# {{lb|ja|rare|sort=こうけ}} the [[emperor]] and [[courtier]]s
